definition: Dresden, capital of Saxony 薩克森州|萨克森州[Sa4 ke4 sen1 zhou1], Germany
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: The first Expressionist group gathered at Dresden in 1905.
sentences.chinese: 第一个表现主义团体于1905年在德累斯顿成立。

sentences.english: A city of east-central Germany on the Elbe River east-southeast of Leipzig.
sentences.chinese: 德累斯顿德国中东部城市，位于莱比锡东南偏东河畔。

sentences.english: Mayan hieroglyphics in the Dresden Codex.
sentences.chinese: 在德累斯顿抄本玛雅象形文字。

sentences.english: Vonnegut prefers not to make a narrative of the Dresden massacre.
sentences.chinese: 冯尼格不想为读者讲述德累斯顿大屠杀的过程。

sentences.english: A city of east-central Germany east of Dresden on the Polish border.
sentences.chinese: 德国中东部一城市，德累斯顿市之东，与波兰毗邻。

sentences.english: Was the firebombing of Dresden a terrorist act?
sentences.chinese: 德国德累斯顿的火焰炸弹是恐怖行动么？

sentences.english: Dr. Johannes Struempfel is working as Chief Scientist at VON ARDENNE Company in Dresden.
sentences.chinese: 他是德国德累斯顿市的冯阿登纳企业的首席科学家。

definition: Nürnberg or Nuremberg, town in Bavaria, Germany
München or Munich, capital of Bavaria, Germany
Stuttgart city in southwest Germany and capital of Baden-Württemberg 巴登·符騰堡州|巴登·符腾堡州[Ba1 deng1 · Fu2 teng2 bao3 zhou1]
Sachsen or Saxony, Bundesland in east of Germany, bordering on Poland and Czech republic, capital Dresden 德累斯頓|德累斯顿[De2 lei4 si1 dun4]
